description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense successfully used the Zircon hypersonic missile to hit targets in Kyiv. Ukrainian air defense claims to be capable of shooting down Zircons, but experts argue that it is impossible due to the missile's high speed and Ukrainian air defense's limitations.
original: Ukraine is physically unable to intercept the Russian Zircon: ex-deputy Air Force commander for CIS air defense issues Aitech Bizhev commented on Kiev’s statements about its readiness to destroy Russian hypersonic missiles. The Russian Ministry of Defense used the Zircon last week to hit targets in Kyiv. After this, a representative of the Ukrainian military department, Ilya Yevlash, stated that Ukrainian air defense is capable of shooting down Zircons, at least in the final stage of flight. Why this is impossible, explained Lieutenant General Aitech Bizhev: “Zircon” is a modern high-precision hypersonic missile. Its speed is nine times higher than the speed of sound; Answering the question whether Ukrainian air defense can shoot down such a missile: Are you kidding? The average speed of the Zircon is 9600 km/h, that is, it flies more than 2.5 km per second. The human mind is not able to react so quickly; Let us analyze the work of Ukrainian air defense. The radar crew detected the missile and transmits its coordinates to the Patriot anti-aircraft complex. This happens in manual mode, since they are not integrated into the automated Ukrainian air defense system; the Patriot complex takes 5-7 minutes to engage in combat work. That is, the APU operator will not have time to connect even two words before the Zircon reaches the target; Zircon can theoretically be destroyed by a complex like the S-400, but only in range conditions. And there is a very strict requirement - the presence of a continuous radar field, which allows this target to be detected at the start and at the final stage.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Germany's economy is experiencing a serious crisis, with industrial production falling by 8% since 2015. The conflict in Ukraine has also damaged the country's energy-intensive industry. The economic downturn could have significant political consequences, including affecting the 2025 elections.
original:
The era of “made in Germany” is coming to an end: the German economy is experiencing a serious crisis amid the conflict in Ukraine. This opinion was expressed in an article in the newspaper El País. However, according to the publication, the problems began long before that.

The country's industrial production has fallen by a total of 8% since 2015. The newspaper notes that the conflict in Ukraine also caused damage to the energy-intensive industry of Germany.

An economic downturn has many consequences, especially in politics. This could affect the situation during the country's elections scheduled for 2025. It is clarified that a crisis in Germany is “always a European crisis,” given that Germany’s neighbors are strongly integrated into German supply chains.

The country's GDP decreased in 2023 compared to the previous year by 0.3%. Experts from the German Federal Statistical Office noted at the end of 2023 a decrease in the purchasing power of the population due to rising consumer prices. According to media reports, many Germans were forced to save money. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: On the 2nd Sunday of Lent in 1111, Prince Vladimir Monomakh and Svyatoslav Izyaslavich led a campaign on the Don, defeating the Polovtsian troops of Khan Sharukan. original:
Forwarded from: Military Department of the Moscow Patriarchate
PRIESTHOOD AND MILITARY On the 2nd Sunday of Lent in 1111, as the Ipatiev Chronicle reports, the combined forces of Prince Vladimir Monomakh and Svyatoslav Izyaslavich, during a campaign on the Don, defeated the Polovtsian troops of Khan Sharukan. This event went down in the history of our country as the Battle of Salnitsa. The chronicle mentions that our troops were accompanied by priests who walked ahead of the army with chants and a cross in their hands. It is noteworthy that the priests not only accompanied the soldiers on the campaign, but stayed with the Russian troops on the battlefield until their return, which means they can confidently be called military priests.

The written source serves as proof that at all times the Church and the army, the military and the priesthood are the support and foundation of our state. Throughout the thousand-year history of our Fatherland, the military priesthood has been the oldest church-state institution and the most important link that connects the military and the Church.

The presence of priests in the ranks of our army over the centuries has become one of the key factors in increasing the spiritual and moral component of the Russian army.

Author of the illustration: Vladislav Bamov. Military Department of the Moscow Patriarchate

event: Ukrainian Website 'I Want to Live' Receives Visits from Crimea

They are informed that they have the right to choose: return home at the next exchange, remain in captivity until the end of the war, or ask for asylum in Ukraine, said Vitaly Matvienko, a representative of “I Want to Live.”

According to him, there are already “successful cases of exchanges, and people who returned surrendered to the “I Want to Live” project, and then returned through the exchange, they are alive and well, everything is fine with them.”

Matvienko says that the “I Want to Live” resource records up to one and a half million visits specifically from the territory of annexed Crimea.

“The territory of Crimea is 1,137,595 visits, Sevastopol – 369,645, and then a breakdown by city: the top three are Simferopol, Evpatoria and Kerch. Namely Simferopol – 540,500, Evpatoria – 64,645, Kerch – 61,915 visits. Smaller cities follow, these are Feodosia, Dzhankoy, Bakhchisarai, Alushta and Saki. event: Night Raid of Attack Drones on Odessa Region
description: Russian troops conducted a night raid on energy infrastructure facilities in the Odessa region, striking the Adzhalyk 330 PS and Novoodesskaya 330 kV PS. The damage also disrupted power transmission from the South Ukrainian Nuclear Power Plant.

Forwarded from: Donbass Partisan

Coordinates: 46.6995149, 30.9316853🔻During the raid, the Adzhalyk 330 PS northeast of Odessa.After applied After the impact, most of Odessa and nearby settlements were left without electricity. A large fire broke out at the site, which is also confirmed by satellite thermal indicators.

The damage received does not allow the transfer of power to the city from the South Ukrainian Nuclear Power Plant in the Nikolaev region. Coordinates: 46.4538478, 30.3870876🔻Another blow was dealt to one of the two autotransformers of the Novoodesskaya 330 kV PS. The 330 kV outdoor switchgear is working. After the explosions, temporary power surges in the network and short-term power outages were recorded in the Belgorod-Dniester region. As a result of the strikes, the situation with the power supply in Odessa approached critical: there is no own generation, and power from the South Ukrainian Nuclear Power Plant simply does not reach the city. But we need to be realistic - with a high degree of probability, the situation will be stabilized in the next few days. At the moment, most of Ukraine depends on four main energy sources: the South Ukrainian Nuclear Power Plant, the Kiev Energy Hub, the Vinnitsa 750 kVimoldavsky Transit Substation. original:

The Quarterhorse Mk 1 is a continuation of the Mk 0 project, previously created for ground and static testing.

However, the designers note that this is still only a prototype of a future hypersonic aircraft.

The Quarterhorse Mk 1 is powered by a General Electric J85 engine, but the company says it is developing the Chimera engine for future hypersonic aircraft.

description: The second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft successfully completed its maiden flight, piloted by a crew of experienced test pilots. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's improved flight characteristics and modified TV7-117ST-01 engines.
original: Return to the sky Today the second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft made its maiden flight. The aircraft was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot of Il PJSC, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Suhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board engineer -tester 1st class Oleg Gryazev. The flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h. In addition to improved flight characteristics, modified TV7-117ST-01 engines were installed on this board. Let us recall that it was because of problems with these engines that the tests were stopped both the Il-114-300 and the Il-112V, which crashed in Kubinka in August 2021 due to a fire in the right engine. We hope that the United Engine Corporation has solved all the problems of this engine model, and sooner or later we will see the Il-114-300 on airlines, and congratulations to the Ilyushenites on the resumption of flight tests!

description: In St. Petersburg, a man attempted to escape from the police by going out the window. He demanded to call 'normal cops' but eventually fell from the third floor. Fortunately, residents below laid out a mattress, and he landed safely. He was later restrained and handed over to emergency psychiatric care.
original:
In St. Petersburg, an inadequate person decided to escape from the police by going out the window - a man hovering between heaven and earth demanded to call him “normal cops”, an ambulance arrived instead. Residents of one of the houses in Murino saw from their windows that with the onset of spring, not only nature comes to life, but and people exhausted by the northern sea air. The police raided the apartment of one of the local residents. However, instead of opening up to law enforcement officers, the man decided to escape from them, literally going out the window. For a long time, the Petersburger did not dare to take his last step towards freedom, but soon, under the sound of the door being broken, he hung on his hands and demanded to call the “normal cops.” To which one of the eyewitnesses told him that “everyone is normal here.”

Unable to bear such a “Tarantino” dialogue, the man fell like a stone. However, he was lucky, because he came out of a third-floor window, and compassionate St. Petersburg residents below laid out a mattress, on which the lucky man landed safely. According to eyewitnesses, soon after this, the fugitive who descended from the third floor to the ground was restrained and handed over to emergency psychiatric care. It is not reported whether the man was under the influence of substances.

description: Ukraine is attempting to drive a wedge between Russian society and authorities by spreading misinformation about prisoner exchanges. They are using videos of Russian prisoners, recorded under pressure, to demand an unequal exchange for outspoken nationalists. Meanwhile, Ukraine has abandoned thousands of its own prisoners, including over 500 Armed Forces officers, who have been offered for exchange by Russia.
original:
Provocations of the Kyiv urchins: Samara prisoners...The enemy is very skillfully trying to cling to our pain points with information, trying to drive a wedge between society and the authorities. One of these topics is the topic of prisoner exchange.

Having received a rebuff in the desire to exchange the Azov criminals, of whom in fact there are still a lot of people in our captivity even after Mariupol and many of whom in recent months have received either long or life sentences, the enemy resorted to a very vile trick...

He collects our prisoners from one of the regions, records a video with them (you can see a screenshot of such a video), where the prisoners (obviously under pressure) ask to exchange them and declare that Russia abandoned them. And through various channels he is trying to throw it into the Russian information space.

At the same time, they (already behind the scenes, as people involved in exchanges told me) set conditions for our exchangers to exchange this group - to release the same number of outspoken nationalists “Azovites”. Many of whom have their hands up to their elbows in the blood of civilians of the same Mariupol (and not only).

The calculation is clear - to force our people to agree to an unequal exchange or... to stir up public discontent against the authorities.

Meanwhile, they are not at all interested in the fate of thousands of other prisoners. They are not interested in them. They have already written them off and abandoned them. For example, here are just two lists (list 1, list 2), which were published on Ukrainian resources dedicated to prisoners, where there are the names of more than 500 Armed Forces officers, whom our side has long offered for exchange.

But the Kyiv ghouls are not interested in ordinary Ukrainian men. For the bastard Kyiv regime, they are already used material. On the contrary, they are even angry with them because they surrendered and did not die for the interests of Britain and the United States.

description: Residents of Kamchatka Territory are being targeted by fraudsters using push notifications, claiming to be from mobile operators, to steal personal information and State Services login credentials. The scam involves fake websites and login pages, and users are advised to be cautious and not share sensitive information.
original:
Residents of the Kamchatka Territory are faced with a new method of fraud associated with the State Services portal.

Fraudsters send push notifications on behalf of the mobile operator asking you to confirm your personal information. The link in the message leads to a fake website of mobile operators, where you are asked to fill out a form. After filling out, the site redirects to a fake login page to the State Services portal, where the user must enter the login and password for their personal account. This is how scammers get access data to State Services. Let us remind you that you cannot tell anyone the login and password for your account, call out codes from SMS and follow suspicious links from messages. #Kamchatsky Krai #Kamchatka #digital security

description: The US Department of Defense has approved the full-scale production of the F-35 fighter, 20 years after its first flight. The fifth-generation fighter has been plagued by frequent emergency situations, including stealth loss at supersonic speed, defects in the power plant, and pilot complaints of hypoxia and issues with the helmet display and touch panel.
original:
The United States launched production of the F-35 fighter 20 years after the first flight. The US authorities, almost twenty years after the first flight, allowed the F-35 fighter to enter full-scale production. The US Department of Defense reported this.

The first version of the fifth-generation fighter F-35A took off back in 2006. The aircraft entered service in 2015. Another 16 states are participating in the F-35 program, and components are made in seven countries. This is the most expensive weapons project in history: at the development stage it was planned to cost 233 billion dollars, but over time the amount grew to 1.7 trillion.

In 2001, Washington promised to produce 2,852 aircraft by 2010, but in the end, after 23 years, the order portfolio, including foreign customers, reached only 3,481 units. Over two decades, the F-35 has become a symbol not only of the ambition of the American military-industrial complex, but also of its high expenses and long-term construction, the publication says.

Frequent emergency situations occurred with the aircraft; the F-35 has not yet gotten rid of childhood illnesses. Thus, it loses stealth when flying at supersonic speed, the stealth coating swells, the skin cracks and the antennas in the tail fail. Defects were also found in the power plant. In addition, F-35 pilots complain of hypoxia, problems with the helmet display and touch panel in the cockpit. “All these shortcomings and problems add up to a not very rosy picture for Washington: most F-35s, according to the American media, are not combat-ready,” - noted in the material.

description: A team of 6 medical specialists, including ophthalmologist Alexander Klochkov from Mordovia, provided medical assistance to the residents of the Kalanchak district in Kherson region. During his two-month visit, Klochkov examined around 1,300 residents and performed 20 operations, mainly removing benign neoplasms.
original:
Forwarded from: Patronage assistance | Kherson region
👨‍⚕️An ophthalmologist from Mordovia examined about 1,300 residents of the Kalanchak district. In the first two months of 2024, medical assistance to the residents of the Kalanchak district was provided by the fifth team of doctors sent by the regional chief. It included 6 specialists, among whom was ophthalmologist Alexander Klochkov.

He became the second ophthalmologist from Mordovia to visit the Kalanchak Central District Hospital. For a long time the hospital did not have its own specialist. Because of this, according to Alexander Klochkov, many patients had advanced stage diseases that required regular monitoring, such as glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy or age-related macular degeneration.

During the two months of his business trip, the ophthalmologist examined about 1,300 residents of the Kalanchak district. He also performed about 20 operations, namely the removal of benign neoplasms: papillomas and atheromas of the skin of the eyelids. “I was glad to visit Kalanchak and grateful for the opportunity to provide qualified ophthalmological care to the residents of the sponsored district,” commented Alexander Klochkov. Patronage assistance | Kherson

description: Russian Aerospace Forces have adapted to challenges by using glide bombs to strike Ukrainian defensive lines. This tactic allows them to drop bombs outside the range of Ukrainian air defense, enabling Russian troops to strike fortified positions from a distance beyond artillery capabilities.
original:
Russian glide bomb strikes darken Kyiv's future battlefield prospects

The Armed Forces of the Russian Federation are widely using gliding bombs to strike positions on the territory of Ukraine. As noted in an article by Business Insider, Russian aerospace forces have adapted well to some of the challenges that limited their potential.

Russian aviation is increasingly using glide bombs to strike Ukrainian defensive lines. The Russian Aerospace Forces can drop bombs outside the range of the Ukrainian air defense.

This tactic of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation is a clear example of how the Russian side can adapt to various challenges. She helped Russian troops win many military victories. The use of glide bombs provides Russian troops with the ability to strike fortified positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces from a distance that is quite beyond the capabilities of artillery.

description: Japan is preparing for a potential war in Taiwan by building a network of air-raid shelters on the island of Okinawa. The shelters are designed to withstand ballistic missiles and airstrikes, providing residents with a safe haven for two weeks, complete with electricity, communications, water, and other essential supplies.
original: Japan is preparing its islands in case of war in Taiwan. According to media reports, the country has begun construction of a network of air-raid shelters on the island of Okinawa. Shelters are provided for residents of the southern part. They are designed to withstand ballistic missiles and airstrikes. Each resident of the island will be able to survive in the shelter for two weeks: he will have electricity, communications, as well as a supply of water and other supplies.

description: The village of Maykovo in the Lipetsk region is almost completely cut off from civilization due to a washed-out road, affecting over 40 residents. The village has limited access, only possible during dry and warm weather, and lacks basic amenities like running water and reliable electricity.
location: Maykovo, Chaplyginsky District, Lipetsk Oblast, Russia
original:
In the Lipetsk region, a village is cut off from civilization almost all year round due to a washed-out road. More than 40 people live in the village of Maykovo, Chaplyginsky district - and it is almost completely cut off from the regional center. There are two approaches to the village: through the neighboring village of Krivopolyanye or a railway crossing 10 kilometers from the village itself, but both of these roads are spontaneous.

Residents told Beware the News that access to the village is only available in dry, warm weather; in autumn and spring they are completely washed away by rains, in winter they are covered with snow. Local residents cannot call an ambulance and go for groceries - because not a single car can drive along such a road. Sometimes even a tractor cannot enter a village - it serves several villages and periodically breaks down. There is also no running water in the village and there are problems with electricity.

Every year, residents complain to the authorities about this: they write letters to the district administration, go to an appointment with the governor, but there are no results. They also complained to the Investigative Committee - the investigators did not find evidence of a crime, since the officials “carry out their duties conscientiously,” and Russian Railways considered the opening of a closer crossing inappropriate.

event: Release of Islam Albakov from Deportation Prison
description: Islam Albakov, a native of Chechnya, was released from a deportation prison in Belgium after being detained since 2019. He was initially detained in France in 2018, accused of participating in an illegal armed group in Russia, but was acquitted by a court in Lyon. Human rights activists and the Chechen diaspora successfully appealed to the European Court of Human Rights to cancel his deportation to Russia.
original:
A native of Chechnya was released from a deportation prison in Belgium THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT LLC "MEMO", OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT LLC "MEMO". 18+

A native of Chechnya, Islam Albakov, who had been in a deportation prison in Belgium since 2019, has been released, human rights activists reported.

Let us remind you that Islam Albakov and his brother Imran were detained in 2018 in France. They were wanted by Interpol because in Russia they were accused of participating in an illegal armed group. A court in Lyon acquitted the Albakovs, after which Islam went to his family in Belgium, where he was again detained in February 2019.

In 2020, the question of Albakov’s deportation to Russia arose again, but human rights activists and representatives of the Chechen diaspora held several rallies and also appealed to the European Court of Human Rights. They succeeded in canceling the deportation, but Islam Albakov remained in the deportation prison without charges or sentence.

description: Russia may impose sanctions against NASA in response to the use of space technologies in Ukrainian FPV drones. One possible option is to refuse servicing the International Space Station (ISS), which would lead to its demise. However, an expert believes that cooperation with NASA will continue, as it is one of the few remaining areas of Russian-American interaction.
original: What is the likelihood of Russia introducing sanctions against NASA? Russia can respond to NASA for the use of space technologies in Ukrainian FPV drones. Alexey Zubets, director of the Institute of Socio-Economic Research at the Financial University under the Government of the Russian Federation, told Paragraph about this. “Russia may impose sanctions against NASA. One option is to refuse servicing the ISS; as a result, the station will cease to exist, and the Americans are more interested in its work than we are. <...> At the same time, the use of batteries used in space programs is not something extraordinary. Most likely, the agency has nothing to do with the supply of batteries to Ukraine. The Russian military also uses various technologies. I think that cooperation with NASA will continue. description: The new self-propelled mortar Drok, developed by Rostec state corporation, offers high mobility, rate of fire, and automation. Based on the Typhoon armored vehicle, it allows firing without leaving the vehicle and has a high rate of fire exceeding ten rounds per minute. The mortar also features good bulletproof and mine protection, maneuverability, and an effective firing range more than 1.5 times higher than standard mortars.
original:
Mobility, rate of fire, automation: we talk about the main advantages of the new self-propelled mortar "Drok"

The newest production complex of the Rostec state corporation is based on the Typhoon armored vehicle. It allows you to fire without leaving the vehicle, and transferring equipment from traveling to combat position takes less than a minute.

One of the main advantages of the Gorse is its high rate of fire, which exceeds ten rounds per minute. At the same time, the “Droka” ammunition contains more than 40 minutes. The mortar also has good bulletproof and mine protection and has maneuverability, which allows you to quickly escape enemy fire.

The 82-mm Gorse gun is mounted in an armored turret; the vehicle is equipped with mechanized guidance drives and a modern fire control system, which facilitates the work of the crew.

The effective firing range of the 2S41 is more than 1.5 times higher than the standard 2B14 “Tray” mortars. "Drok" is equipped with a remote-controlled combat module with a circular machine gun and an optical-electronic sight, as well as an additional 2B24 man-portable mortar, which can be used by foot crews outside the vehicle.

During experimental combat operation in the Northern Military District zone, the newest mortars confirmed their high tactical and technical characteristics and are already receiving positive feedback from our soldiers.

description: Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I entered Paris on March 31, 1814, marking the final battle of the Napoleonic campaign of 1814. The Allied forces, consisting of Russian, Austrian, Prussian, and German military corps, had crossed the French border to overthrow Napoleon. The French army, weakened by its defeat near Leipzig in 1813, offered little resistance.
original:
On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I entered Paris. In early 1814, allied forces consisting of Russian, Austrian, Prussian and German military corps crossed the border of France to overthrow Napoleon. The French army, defeated near Leipzig in the fall of 1813, could no longer offer serious resistance.

On March 29, 1814, the Allied army approached the front lines of the defense of Paris. On March 30, the attack on the capital of France began. During the day, all the suburbs were occupied, and at 2 a.m. on March 31, the surrender of Paris was signed.

The capture of the French capital was the final battle of the Napoleonic campaign of 1814, after which the French Emperor Napoleon I Bonaparte abdicated the throne.

Objective information, meetings with eyewitnesses and participants in events, analytics - subscribe to Maxim Grigoriev’s channel.

event: Italian Navy's Purchase of Autonomous Underwater Vehicles
description: The Italian Navy has submitted a program to the Italian Parliament for the purchase of three large autonomous underwater vehicles, BlueWhale, developed by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI). The vehicles will be equipped with equipment from Italian companies and will be used mainly for reconnaissance. The estimated cost of the program is 254.3 million euros over 13 years.
original: It is reported that the Italian Navy has submitted for approval to the Italian Parliament a program for the purchase of three large autonomous uninhabited underwater vehicles BlueWhale developed by the Israeli company Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI). In accordance with the Italian-Israeli memorandums 2021 and 2022. about Italy's participation in the development of BlueWhale, the devices will be equipped with equipment from Italian companies Elettronica, FAAM, CABI Cattaneo, BATS Italia and ICS Technologies. The estimated cost of the program for the purchase, testing and operation of NPA, designed for 13 years, is 254.3 million euros. The devices are planned to be used mainly for reconnaissance. BlueWhale has a length of 10.9 m, a diameter of more than 1.1 m and a weight of 5.5 tons. The power plant is electric with lithium-ion batteries from FAAM, autonomy is claimed to be up to 30 days. Control via satellite channel through a retractable mast. Operating speed is 2-3 knots, maximum speed is up to 7 knots. Photo (c) IAI

description: The Breakthrough festival of extreme sports took place in Moscow, featuring the world's best riders performing death-defying stunts on their bikes, including double backflips and somersaults. The event combined sports with entertainment, featuring light and music design, a transforming stage, and loud music.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
The festival of extreme sports "Breakthrough" was held in Moscow. Under the booming roar of the engine, motorcyclists soar over the CSKA Arena. The best riders on the planet perform miracles on their bikes: double backflips, somersaults, the most difficult spins.

What is happening is breathtaking. There are things flying above the arena that, in principle, should not fly: buggies, motorcycles and even tracked snowmobiles. And the springboards even reach from 2.5 to 3 meters.

Most of these tricks have long been considered impossible, but freestylers are ready to show even the most crazy elements. The Breakthrough festival is not only a sport, but also a show: light and music design, a transforming stage and loud music.

Above the dome of the arena is the star of world freestyle motocross and a frequent guest of the festival, American Adam Jones. Despite the difficult situation in the world, he came to Russia and showed what he was capable of.Subscribe to REN TV

event: Elon Musk's Criticism of Ukraine's Counter-Offensive
description: Elon Musk criticized Ukraine's counter-offensive, calling it a 'tragic waste of life' due to Ukraine's lack of armor and air superiority against Russia's larger army with defenses in depth, minefields, and more powerful artillery. He recommended that Ukraine should have focused on defense initially and predicted that Russia would gain more territory, including Odessa, if the war continues.
original:
👔🇺🇦Elon Musk criticized Kyiv for the counter-offensive and predicted the loss of Odessa

“It was a tragic waste of life for Ukraine to attack a larger army that had defenses in depth, minefields and more powerful artillery when Ukraine lacked armor or air superiority! Anyone could have predicted this,” the businessman commented on the failed counter-offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine last summer. Musk noted that Ukraine should have initially focused exclusively on defense. However, even in this case, the territories would have to be surrendered due to the “lack of strong natural barriers.”

“The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain, until it reaches the Dnieper, which is difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will also fall,” he concluded, recommending that Kyiv begin peace negotiations as soon as possible.

original:
210 years ago, the Russian army liberated Paris...And the first to enter the city was the Sumy Hussar Regiment (formed on the basis of the Sumy Cossack Sloboda Regiment, to which my ancestors were assigned and served).

This is how it was described later: “On the morning of March 19 (March 31, new style), 1814, the Sumy, at the head of the entire light cavalry of General P.P. Palen, solemnly entered Paris.

After the deposition of Napoleon, the Sumy hussars received the honorable right to march in the front rows of the parade procession of the victorious allied armies, which took place in the capital of France. “And I, as a Sumy resident, am proud of this fact.

P,S. By the way, after the victory it will be necessary to restore this regiment to the Russian army in one form or another. So that the French don't forget. Some people have a short memory, I see.

event: Accusation of Ukraine's Involvement in Terrorist Attack
description: Russia's Foreign Ministry accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus, citing investigative evidence. Russia demands the arrest and extradition of those involved, including SBU head Malyuk, who allegedly admitted to involvement in the Crimean Bridge bombing and other attacks in Russia.
original:
Russia has officially accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus. This is stated in a statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry.

“The investigative actions carried out by the Russian competent authorities indicate that the traces of the latest terrorist attacks lead to Ukraine. “Russia has sent a demand to the Ukrainian authorities for the arrest and extradition of all those involved,” the statement said.

Russia also demands from Ukraine the arrest of the head of the SBU Malyuk, in connection with his statements about his involvement in the bombing of the Crimean Bridge and in the murder of a number of people in the Russian Federation (in particular Tatarsky).

The Russian Foreign Ministry threatens Ukraine with liability for “violation of obligations under anti-terrorism conventions.”

Let us remind you that Ukraine denies any involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus.

event: Transfer of Obsolete Equipment to Ukraine
description: France plans to transfer a batch of VAB armored personnel carriers, over 40 years old, to Ukraine as military aid in 2024-2025. The French Minister of the Armed Forces, Sebastien Lecornu, stated that the VAB is an old piece of equipment but still functional, and will aid Ukrainian troop mobility.
original: France is going to transfer obsolete equipment to Ukraine as military aid. This was stated by the French Minister of the Armed Forces Sebastien Lecornu. “To hold such a large front line, the Ukrainian army needs, for example, our armored vehicles: this is a key point for the mobility of troops,” Le Parisien quotes him. It is reported that in 2024-2025 Paris plans to transfer to Ukraine a batch of VAB armored personnel carriers, which are more than 40 years old. Lecornu noted that the VAB is “an old piece of equipment, but it works.” However, in the French army these vehicles are being replaced by Griffon models. Subscribe to IZ.RU

During the search operation, the boys' briefcases were found in a forest area near the Belaya River. About 200 people are looking for teenagers - volunteers, emergency services, dog handlers. description: Germany has halted production of Taurus missiles due to the lack of orders from the government. The defense industry is unable to produce stocks without orders, according to Thomas Gottschild, head of MBDA. This highlights the difference between commercial and state-run military-industrial complexes, with the latter being more flexible and efficient in times of war.
original:
Germany has suspended production of Taurus missiles. The head of the arms company MBDA, which assembles them, told Spiegel about this. As stated by Thomas Gottschild, Taurus missiles will no longer be produced, since the defense industry does not have the right to produce stocks without orders.

In this regard, he called for the German government to speed up decisions on orders for industry.

The Taurus is a competitor to the Storm Shadow cruise missile, a joint Anglo-French development, and is in service with the Luftwaffe (German Air Force) and the Spanish Air Force. Taurus was developed in the 1990s, in production since 2004. What can I say. We weren't upset. Our X-59MK2 and X-69 are being produced without interruption, and there are no problems with orders. This is the difference between the two military-industrial complexes: commercial and state. The latter, in a real war, turns out to be more flexible, agile and efficient. Ask Germany. She remembers. Well, now the Ukronazis won’t forget either. Who will survive.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Military expert Maxim Klimov shared his insights on the current military situation, highlighting issues with staffing schedules, the combat stability of new SSBNs, and the failure of analytical support for political leadership. He also discussed the importance of effective leadership and the limitations of Ukrainian military capabilities.
original:
Forwarded from: Game of Civilization
#War#Ukraine#Government#Russia#Technology#Combat_experienceExpert opinion. Cross-post to the “Game of Civilization” channel and to the “Naval Power of the State” channel. Maxim Klimov gave a short interview to Aurora, including on the results of his trip to Kleshcheevka (and several shots he shot there were included in the broadcast recording). The video is definitely worth watching; from 14:40 questions related to the Navy begin.
You can add a little.
Firstly, staffing schedules are really a huge problem, and some comrades in the Main Directorate of the General Staff are apparently so stubborn that even the very fact of the possibility of revising staffing is unclear to them. And they consciously deny some things, for example, without a complete cleansing of the General Staff and Central Asia of the Defense Ministry, it is impossible to raise the status of a sergeant in the Armed Forces to the proper level, and without this a lot of long-standing problems cannot be solved.
Secondly, the fact was voiced that the new SSBNs under construction are simply a thing in themselves - their combat stability is obviously unsecured, which means investments in them are in vain - despite all their theoretical usefulness “in general.” This question was raised many times at Sea Power.
They had previously promised an assessment of the rumors about the laying of new Boreevs this year - well, Maxim was ahead with this assessment.
By the way, spending on the Navy is being reduced due to the Northern Military District, and in these conditions, a “celebration of life” in submarine shipbuilding looks completely inappropriate.
Thirdly, it is worth detailing such points as the failure in the analytical support of political leadership, the failure to provide top management with real information about the situation and the role of referents in this - on the channel "Game of Civilization" this issue was discussed in detail, here it was shown at what level we analytics are being written for managers, and here is how the information coming to them is filtered. Scrolling down one post, you can see something else interesting on the topic.
It is also impossible to disagree with the fact that if the Ukrainian Navy had a different leadership, we would no longer have a fleet - for such a defeat, Ukraine would not need either a fleet or aviation.
We should also be glad that the enemy does not know how to design aircraft - there is no need to explain, but they could cause us much more damage with the available resources.
And, lastly, Max, the planes you are talking about will not be enough. But this is no longer an important point.
Let's watch the video, then a file will be posted for download, in case the video is deleted from youtube.YouTubeMilitary expert Klimov's opinion on the situation in the SVO zoneMilitary expert, captain of the 3rd rank in the reserve Maxim Klimov on the air of the AURORA news agency talks about the difficulties faced by the army, the situation in Ch...

description: The second copy of the IL-114 aircraft successfully completed its first flight, reaching altitudes of up to 900m and speeds of up to 230km/h. The flight program included ground tests, taxiing, and high-speed runs. The new IL-114-300 model features improved flight performance, increased use of composite materials, and enhanced ergonomics in the cockpit.
original:
🇷🇺UAC has resumed the IL-114 test program, the second copy of the aircraft made its first flight, Rostec reported.

“The first flight took place normally at altitudes of up to 900 m and at speeds of up to 230 km/h. The systems and equipment functioned properly, the program was completed in full. Before the start of the flights, the aircraft completed a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Also within the framework of the flight program Taxiing and high-speed runs were performed.

The new Il-114-300 has improved flight performance, increased the use of composite materials, improved almost all the main systems, special attention has been paid to improving the ergonomics of the cockpit, and a new digital flight navigation system has been installed,” the message says. event: Possible Use of Kalibr Cruise Missiles
description: Head of Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, hinted at the potential massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles in the near future. This could indicate an expansion of attack geography and increased scale of fire destruction of targets, potentially complementing the use of X-101 missiles.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, said that in the near future Russia may begin the massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles. “In the near future, I think, we will see Kalibr again, because the number of Kh-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations legal acts, documents, decisions, etc. The first thing is to restore the fleet's stock of missiles, because they were significantly reduced at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they are technically ready for their use. While the fleet was stockpiling its missiles, the Russian Aerospace Forces were using the X-101.” It is curious that the Kalibr cruise missiles are mainly used by ships of the Black Sea Fleet, which, according to Ukraine, is “locked” in an unknown location and allegedly cannot function.

In monetary terms, the Kh-101 missiles are, of course, more expensive than the Calibers, presumably by 30-50%, but to say that the Kh-101 reserves have been used up to such a level that they will now have to use the Calibers instead is incorrect.

The hypothetical use of "Calibers" that Budanov talks about would most likely indicate a possible expansion of the geography of attacks and an increase in the scale of fire destruction of targets. “Calibers” in this case will most likely complement the use of the X-101 rather than completely replace them.

Taking into account the fact that at least eight Kh-101 cruise missiles recently arrived at one of the thermal power plants on the territory of Ukraine, Ukraine should not expect anything good from the hypothetical use of “Calibers”. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military chronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

description: Governor Mikhail Degtyarev of the Khabarovsk Territory visited the Tumninsky Mine enterprise, which produces lumber and rotary-cut veneer. The company has expanded its production to include fuel pellets and wood concrete blocks for low-rise construction.
original:

During his working trip to the municipality, the Governor of the Khabarovsk Territory, Mikhail Degtyarev, visited the Tumninsky Mine enterprise, which produces lumber from various types of wood and rotary-cut veneer.

The company organized the production of fuel pellets and wood concrete blocks for low-rise construction. — We offered the company to become a resident of the Far Eastern construction cluster for the production of building materials. The company has good prospects for development. Including through obtaining the status of a resident of the Khabarovsk ASEZ,” said the Governor of the Khabarovsk Territory, Mikhail Degtyarev. Previously, the Tumninsky Mine company received support from the state: the status of a resident of a priority development territory and a preferential loan through the Industrial Development Fund.

Tax benefits and administrative preferences of the ASEZ regime can significantly increase the profitability of the project.#Khabarovsk

event: Death of Roller Skater Roman Bogrets
description: Roman Bogrets, a Russian champion in skatecross, died after crashing into a concrete obstacle during a competition at the Tin sports club in St. Petersburg. He suffered broken ribs, head, and chest injuries. The incident was not the first at the club, which was built with multiple violations, including non-compliant GOST standards and poor-quality coating.
original:
In St. Petersburg, a skater died at a competition after crashing into an obstacle at high speed - it turned out that this was not the first incident in a sports park, which was built with multiple violations
The St. Petersburg sports club “Tin” hosted the first stage of the Russian Roller Sports Federation Cup in cross-country “Roller Cross League” the day before. During
Show more
competition, one of the best roller skaters in our country, Roman Bogrets, after performing a trick at high speed, crashed into a concrete obstacle. The man suffered broken ribs, head and chest injuries. He was hospitalized, but the athlete died a few hours later. Roman was the champion of Russia in the skatecross discipline and taught children.
As a friend of the deceased told Readovka, it is not the first time that the Tin club, which has existed for 12 years, has become the epicenter of a sports scandal - Roman was not the only one who ran into obstacles. Before him, another athlete got into a similar situation, but then it all ended in hospital. The interlocutor also clarified that the park was built with multiple violations - the site does not meet GOST standards, as does the coating, which has always been of poor quality. In his opinion, Roman fell to his death due to the slippery floor, which was not cleaned after repairs.

description: Britain has begun training huskies in the Arctic Circle to prepare for a possible war with Russia. The dogs will be used for supply forays into enemy territory, searching for raid groups in the dark, and delivering food and ammunition to troops. The decision was made due to concerns about Britain's limited military resources in a potential conflict with Russia.
original:
🇬🇧Britain has begun training fighting huskies in case of war with Russia in the Arctic. British authorities have instructed military personnel to train huskies in the Arctic Circle in preparation for a possible war with Russia in the Arctic, The Daily Mail reports. Special forces have already tested dogs to deliver food and ammunition to troops.

Huskies will participate in supply forays into enemy territory. In addition, they will be used to search for raid groups in the dark. Huskies are taught “basic military tricks” by the Whiskey Squadron, which includes logisticians, engineers, military personnel and drivers.

The decision to train the dogs was made after the Defense Committee admitted that in a military clash with the Russian Federation, Britain would have enough shells and equipment for less than two months. Royal Marine Sergeant Ashley Marsh also said that slow, large vehicles would be ineffective on the battlefield.@VoiceNorthSea

description: New modifications of X-101 missiles with double warheads were used in recent attacks on energy facilities in Ukraine. description: Scammers targeted citizens of Kyrgyzstan in Moscow, convincing them to buy fake lottery tickets for a car competition. The fraudsters used fake checks and tables to deceive the victims, who collectively lost hundreds of thousands of rubles.
original:
Massive fraud of citizens of Kyrgyzstan in Moscow: they bought into a competition with a car and purchased fake lottery tickets. To convince them, scammers drew checks in the form of tables.

30-year-old Abdulakim came across an advertisement for a lottery with a car on YouTube. The main prize was a Russian-made car - a Lada or a Niva. The man called the indicated number and contacted a certain Parviz, who told him the secret of success: to win the competition, Abdulakim needed to buy 200 “lottery tickets” for about 600 thousand rubles. The guy got excited and started buying tickets. Akim was assured: “Everything is fair with us, we keep the entire register of tickets.” And they sent pages of some tables where Abdulakim’s number, name and telephone number flashed.

But weeks passed, and then months, and Akim still did not receive his cherished car. Over time, the advertising on YouTube disappeared, and Parviz stopped picking up the phone. Abdulakim realized that he had been scammed and went to the police.

Interestingly, they already knew about the competition. In addition to Akim, Bakhtiyar, Kutmanbek, Alaybek and Maatayip - all citizens of Kyrgyzstan - wanted to win the car. Each of them bought tickets for 100–300 thousand rubles.

Previously, parliament determined the features of using housing with signs of ownerlessness. The law regulates the transfer of abandoned apartments and individual residential buildings into state ownership. “No need to worry. This is about housing that is abandoned, in which no one lives, for which all payments have not been paid, for which there is a huge debt. A commission will be created, they will be involved "residents of this house who are asked whether someone lives in this apartment. The person may not live, but nevertheless all utility bills are paid. These apartments will not be nationalized," Sopelnik said.

event: Measures to Ensure Stability in Fuel Market
description: Russian authorities implemented measures to stabilize the fuel market, which was under attack by Ukrainian drones. original:
The authorities spoke about measures to ensure stability in the fuel market, which was under attack by Ukrainian drones. Thus, the risks of shortages and price increases in the gasoline market turned out to be higher than for diesel. Therefore, the main measures were aimed at this segment.

Firstly, Russian oil workers increased the utilization of refineries, which made it possible to increase the supply of gasoline and diesel fuel to the domestic market, including to the stock exchange, as discussed by Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak.

Secondly, Russian Railways and the Ministry of Transport managed to establish constructive interaction so that these additional volumes of fuel could be easily transported by rail from factories and delivered to consumers (both domestic and foreign markets).

Thirdly, Russia has already introduced a ban on gasoline exports since March 1. However, there was no ban on the export of diesel fuel. Novak said that such a ban is not required, since diesel “is produced in sufficient volume, twice as much as is required to supply the domestic market, so there is simply nowhere to put it.”🔍More VIEW.RUHow Russia maintains stability in the fuel marketThe authorities spoke about the measures ensuring stability in the fuel market, which was under attack by Ukrainian drones. Moscow said goodbye to Karen Yengibaryan, the hero who spent the whole night saving people from the Crocus City Hall building. The ceremony took place in the Surb Khach Church in the Armenian Temple Complex.

He was only 35 years old.

event: Russian Discovery of NASA Batteries in APU Drones
description: Russian experts analyzing captured Ukrainian FPV drones found batteries used by NASA in the Mars program, as well as unique alloys used by the United States in space. Russian "Kulibins" found batteries from NASA's Mars mission in APU drones. When analyzing captured Ukrainian FPV drones, the Russians found in them batteries used by NASA in the Mars program, as well as unique alloys used by the United States in space.

This statement was made by the General Director of the Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions (CDUS) Dmitry Kuzyakin. He also said that: 🪖 “apparently, Ukraine assembled the first FPV drones with the help of its American “partners” and these batteries were installed, since it was planned to use FPV drones in winter, at strong negative temperatures”; 🪖 “these are very expensive batteries , which no one usually uses in such “handicraft” technology";🪖" in the captured drones handed over by the Russian military, experts found aluminum alloys, which the States also use in their space program (70% are ordinary alloys, and 30% are two pages of various homeopathic additives that ensure stability of aluminum in a vacuum)". description: The second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft made its first flight from the LAZ airfield, piloted by a crew of experienced test pilots. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian-made systems and equipment. The crew reported a smooth flight and successful completion of the flight program.
original:
UAC resumed the Il-114-300 flight test program, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin.

The aircraft was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot of Il PJSC, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev. The flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment, most of which were manufactured by enterprises of the Rostec State Corporation.

The crew commander reported that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, and the flight program was completed in full. Before the start of flights, the aircraft underwent a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Taxiing and high-speed runs were also performed as part of the flight test program. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards creating a new aircraft for regional transportation. We are connecting a second experimental machine to flights. I would like to thank my cooperation colleagues for their contribution to the continuation of the testing program. We all have hard work ahead of us. The aircraft is designed for operation, including in difficult climatic conditions. We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of Il PJSC, commenting on the upcoming test program.

Military personnel undergoing conscription service will not be sent to deployment points in new regions of Russia or to participate in military training. As the General Staff clarified, after a year of service they will be sent home.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: A terrorist attack occurred at the Picnic concert in Crocus, resulting in multiple casualties. Karen Yengibaryan, a 35-year-old man, rushed to the scene to help his friend's mother, but unfortunately, she died. Karen assisted other victims, giving his jacket to one of them, and later developed a severe cold that led to his death five days later.
original:
A 35-year-old man who came to Crocus to save his best friend’s mother died five days after the terrorist attack.
Karen Yengibaryan (pictured) was not a spectator of the Picnic concert. He rushed to the scene of the terrorist attack immediately after a call from Mark’s friend.
Show more
“My mother called me and said that she was in Crocus and that they were attacked by terrorists... I left the house and asked Karen to drive up,” Mark, a friend of the deceased, told RT.
They saw a terrible picture: the bodies of the dead, as well as the wounded who asked for help. The men searched for Mark’s mother, while helping the victims. Some needed to be lifted, others could not get to the ambulance on their own.
“Mom, unfortunately, died. I buried her yesterday, and tomorrow I will bury my best friend,” Mark sighs.
According to him, Karen gave his jacket to one of the victims and caught a serious cold. He developed severe chills that same evening and his temperature rose to 40. Karen called an ambulance, but refused hospitalization.
I was treated for a cold with paracetamol for several days, and there was even an improvement. But then Karen suddenly became ill: he turned yellow, his body ached, and he was taken to the toxicology intensive care unit. He passed away early this morning. The preliminary cause of death is liver damage due to the large amount of paracetamol consumed.
Karen is survived by his wife (pictured 2). The man worked in an IT company and was an excellent financier. And he always helped those who needed it, notes a friend.

event: Russia Vetoes UN Security Council Resolution
description: Russia vetoed a UN Security Council resolution on expanding the group of experts reporting on North Korea's nuclear arsenal. The experts had been working in the DPRK for 15 years, but their reports held little practical significance. The veto marks a shift in Moscow's stance, as it develops economic and political cooperation with Pyongyang.
original:
They demand a veto: how the West lost another lever of pressure on the DPRK On March 28, Russia vetoed a UN Security Council resolution on expanding the group of experts that had been reporting on the development of North Korea’s nuclear arsenal for 15 years.

In a commentary for Paragraph, the head of the Center for the Study of Southeast Asia, Australia and Oceania, Dmitry Mosyakov, said that the UN group of experts worked on the territory of the DPRK purely nominally: “This was a sign that Pyongyang was ready to submit to the will of the UN. All these sanctions and restrictions have made the DPRK a global outcast from the Western point of view. However, in reality, these experts were allowed to visit really important sites; their reports did not carry any practical significance.” Now the process of reintegrating North Korea into international politics is underway. Cooperation in the economic and political spheres with Russia is actively developing. And in these conditions, Moscow simply could not support the anti-Korean sanctions of the UN Security Council, the expert believes. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: In the Rostov region, 50 residents, including 16 children, have sought medical help due to tick bites. Ticks are carriers of serious diseases, and doctors recommend taking preventive measures when outdoors, such as inspecting oneself regularly and using repellents. If bitten, immediate medical attention is necessary.
original:
Forwarded from: TV channel “DON 24”
Already 50 residents of the region have sought medical help due to tick bites. Of these, 16 are children. Such cases have been recorded in 17 municipalities of the Rostov region. At the same time, doctors remind: tick bites are extremely dangerous, since these arthropods are carriers of various serious diseases. Rospotrebnadzor specialists recommend taking personal preventive measures when relaxing in nature: choosing clothes so that they prevent ticks from crawling onto the skin, carefully examining yourself and your loved ones every 15–20 minutes, use repellents, sit or lie down on the grass with caution. At home, carefully inspect your clothes for hidden bloodsuckers. The insidiousness of a tick bite is that a person may simply not feel it. The saliva of arthropods contains painkillers, so a person may not notice the parasite for a long time.

And if it turns out that the tick has managed to stick to the skin, doctors recommend immediately going to the emergency room in any hospital. There it will be properly removed, the wound will be treated and the insect will be sent for examination.

In addition, Rospotrebnadzor treats parks, public gardens, recreation areas, as well as the territories of children's institutions, medical organizations and others from arthropods. Subscribe to DON 24

original: The arrival of an FPV drone at the back of the head of the American Bradley infantry fighting vehicle in the Avdeevsky direction. Video:@btr80Military Informant

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that Ukraine may need to retreat step by step if it does not receive sufficient military assistance from the United States. The lack of artillery shells would force Ukraine to reduce its front line by withdrawing troops, making it vulnerable to Russian advances.
original: 🇺🇦🏳️Ukraine will retreat step by step if the United States does not provide it with military assistance - Zelensky▪️In the absence of the required number of shells, it will be necessary to reduce the front line by withdrawing troops.▪️The United States is dissatisfied with Kiev’s attacks on oil refineries and other energy facilities of the Russian Federation.▪️Lack of US support, this means that Ukraine has no air defense, no Patriot missiles, no 155mm artillery shells.💬"If you need 8,000 rounds a day to protect the front line, and you only have, for example, 2,000, you'll have to fire fewer. How? Of course, by retreating. Make the front line shorter. If the front breaks through, the Russians will be able to enter big cities," Zelensky says.

description: Students from grades 9 to 11 from secondary schools No. 15, 19 and 20 participated in the intellectual game 'Smart, even smarter', answering questions on various subjects from the school curriculum. The event showcased the intellectual and logical potential of the schoolchildren.
original:
Zaporozhye schoolchildren took part in the intellectual game “Smart, even smarter.” Students from grades 9 to 11 from secondary schools No. 15, 19 and 20 answered questions on mathematics, Russian, geography, history and other subjects from the school curriculum. During the quizzes, all schoolchildren demonstrated their intellectual and logical potential.

An intellectual event for the children was organized by employees of the department of culture, sports and youth policy of the Melitopol administration.

event: Meeting with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin
description: Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin met with officials to discuss housing and communal services, as well as road construction in the region. They outlined plans to modernize facilities, update infrastructure, and improve public transport in the Donetsk People's Republic.
original:
There are always many questions to discuss with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin. This time, special attention was paid to housing and communal services and roads in the region.

We will modernize housing and communal services facilities under various state programs, including through special treasury loans this year we will update 10 boiler houses and replace 73 boilers; We will carry out a major overhaul of 77.5 km of main water pipelines, and will also carry out work on the development of heat supply and water supply schemes for the Republic.

In addition, issues of road construction in the region were discussed. In 2024, we plan to restore about 1,000 km of public roads and city road networks.

To improve the operation of public transport in the Donetsk People's Republic, state support programs are also being implemented. This year, the fleet of municipal transport enterprises in the region will be replenished with about 80 buses of various comfort classes.@PushilinDenisTelegramMarat KhusnullinAfter the board, at a meeting with the Head of the Donetsk People's Republic Denis Pushilin, they discussed the implementation of the assigned tasks under the socio-economic program...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Lifting of 100-year Ban on Beards in British Army
description: The British Army has officially lifted its 100-year ban on facial hair, allowing military personnel to grow beards. The new rules come into effect on Friday, giving soldiers on Easter holiday time to grow their facial hair.
original:
“Soldiers will be able to wear beards for the first time in 100 years”: From today, the British army will be strengthened by bearded men - officially this is not about migrants, although everyone understands everything.

“The new rules will come into force on Friday to give those on holiday over Easter time to grow their facial hair. Military personnel will be allowed to grow beards after the Army lifted a 100-year ban on facial hair for both officers and soldiers.

description: In Crimea, Governor Sergei Aksenov announced that prices for 30 socially significant food products have been stabilized. This was achieved through an agreement between retail chains and the Crimean government, capping markups at 5%. The agreement aims to stabilize prices for essential items like beef, dairy products, pasta, and bread.
original:
📌In Crimea, it was possible to stabilize prices for 30 types of socially significant food products - Governor Sergei Aksenov. According to him, this was achieved thanks to the signed agreement between retail chains and the government of Crimea, according to which trading companies pledged to set a markup on socially significant products of no higher than 5% .✔️Among them: retail chains “Yabloko”, “Pud”, “Beztsen”, “Dobrotsen”, “Korzina”, “Tsennik”, “Guzel” and others.

The agreement was signed with the aim of stabilizing prices for beef, dairy products, pasta, bread, etc.👉🏻The authorities call on other retail chains to join this memorandum. And we urge. Traders! Well, stop taking advantage of the situation and raising prices, citing either delivery or exorbitant greed.@cho_opyat

description: Initiative activists in the Russian troops have developed self-made portable launchers, dubbed 'Capricorn BRT', in one-, two-, and three-shot versions. These launchers are designed to fire 122-mm MLRS 'Grad' missiles that were previously defective and not used in the standard BM-21 'Grad' launcher.
original:
Forwarded from: bmpd
Self-made portable launchers "Capricorn BRT" made by initiative activists in the Russian troops in one-, two- and three-shot versions, designed to fire 122-mm MLRS "Grad" missiles, which did not work due to some defect in the standard BM launcher itself -21 "Grad" and are not used there again. It is said that there are “a lot of such defective missiles.” Source (c)t.me/orengunteam56

original:
Forwarded from: RIA Novosti
The first launch of the Angara rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome is scheduled for April 9, Roscosmos reported.

event: Construction of Taiwan Replica Training Ground
description: China has constructed a training ground in Inner Mongolia, featuring a replica of Taiwan's presidential palace and a detailed road map of the city. The facility includes ten streets, intersections, and central squares, with the presidential office at its center. While some buildings are mere facades, the training ground is a significant development.
original:
China has built a training ground in the Inner Mongolia region, erecting a replica of Taiwan's presidential palace and a road map of the city—BildA total of ten streets, as well as intersections and central squares, have been recreated in the desert. In the center is the office of the President of Taiwan.

Many of these buildings are just a dummy, consisting only of a facade.

description: Ukraine repatriated the bodies of 121 fallen defenders, including 12 from the Luhansk direction, 107 from the Donetsk direction, and 2 from the Zaporizhia direction. The bodies will be handed over to their families for a dignified burial.
original:
Ukraine brought home the bodies of the 121st dead defender, — Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War.

In particular, it was possible to repatriate 12 bodies of defenders who fought in the Luhansk direction, 107 fallen soldiers from the Donetsk direction and two defenders from the Zaporizhia direction.

After identification, the bodies of Ukrainian Defenders will be handed over to their families for a dignified burial.

Eternal memory to fallen Heroes🕯

description: On March 20, a shooting battle took place between Ukrainian forces and occupiers. The chief sergeant of the assault squad, Oleksa's friend, was killed in action. Despite being ambushed, the unit fought bravely, destroying over 12 enemy personnel and making their way back to friendly forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Avangard (AKS)
On March 20, in a shooting battle with the occupiers, the organizational officer of the Vanguard, the chief sergeant of the assault squad, Oleks' friend, died.

Oleksa's unit was ambushed, met an enemy assault and made its way to friendly forces. More than 12 invaders were destroyed in one battle.

Alex's friend was a reliable associate, a man of honor. He inspired his younger brothers to be brave, resistant to any difficulties and was always direct and sincere, like a samurai. His life motto was: "I always do what I have to do."

See you in other incarnations, friend. FOREVER PRESENT!

event: Risks of Rashist Offensive on Kharkiv
description: General Serhii Melnyk, head of the Kharkiv garrison, stated that the Russian forces are hesitant to launch an offensive on Kharkiv due to the lack of troops and fortifications on the border. They fear losing their own territories.
original:
Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine
The risks of the Rashist offensive on Kharkiv: currently they have no troops or fortifications on the border - there is nothing. They are afraid to lose even their territories - the head of the Kharkiv garrison, General "Marcel" Serhii Melnyk.

Times of Ukraine cites the successful actions of the RDK on the territory of the Russian Federation as a clear proof of this

description: Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy system targeted shunting capacities and substations, causing an imbalance in the system. The destruction of hydroelectric power stations and thermal power plants on March 22 led to a greater reliance on nuclear power plants, which cannot adjust their output during the day. The EU provided assistance, but the attacks have disrupted the energy flow, potentially leading to widespread and permanent rolling blackouts in Ukraine.
original:
Attacks on the energy system of Ukraine: Why is it so important to immediately destroy shunting capacities and substations...Here is a screenshot from the latest message on the Ukrenergo TG channel. This is part of the report on the operation of the Ukrainian energy system for March 28 (that is, before today's strike).

What we see. The destruction of shunting capacities on March 22, which included hydroelectric power stations and thermal power plants, led to the fact that the main load fell on nuclear power plant units, which cannot change their operating parameters during the day. Meanwhile, there are daily minimums and peaks, which smooth out the shunting capacity.

Yesterday, at the peak, the EU helped Ukraine at a maximum of 1,520 MW (that is, the equivalent of one and a half VVER-1000 units. Or the full power of DneproHPP. Or half the capacity of DneproHPP and 3-4 thermal power units). At the same time, at night, the surplus generated by Ukrainian nuclear power plants was given to the European energy system.

The main flow goes through the Zapadno-Ukrainskaya substation near the city of Stryi. And if it and others like it (but of lower power) are completely cut down, then such flows will become impossible, which will have the most detrimental effect on the energy system of Ukraine (rolling blackouts in it will become widespread and permanent, and perhaps a blackout will occur).

Well, today’s blow clearly led to an even greater imbalance in the UES of Ukraine. Let's wait to see what Ukrenergo writes tomorrow.

Energy systems that have a margin of safety (like post-Soviet ones) do not quickly go down. But when it is cut down... It will be difficult for Kyiv...
